name: CC0408 - ITP-006 - Trenching, Laying and Backfill for Box Culverts and Headwalls
template name: CC0408 - ITP-006 - Trenching, Laying and Backfill for Box Culverts and Headwalls

name: Acceptance criteria - Ensure all safety components including SWMS, Plant prestart inspections and workers inducted are completed prior to works commencing.
○ View and understand the applicable Site Environmental Management Plans.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -

Acceptance criteria - Prior to excavations being carried out, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out all drainage lines including manholes, temporary benchmarks, sewage wet wells etc.
○ Chainage, offsets, cut/fill level, cutting slopes, grades and cross sections specified or shown on the drawings, etc.
○ Peg location of proposed underground services with levels from pit to pit.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
2.1 - Excavate to width and depth as per survey
Acceptance criteria - Trench depth shall allow for 600mm minimum cover from top of culvert, unless otherwise stated in Civil Drawings.
○ Trench Width shall be 300mm each side of Culvert
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
Acceptance criteria - Compacted Bedding material shall be 100mm. When the pipe sections are in position, the bedding material shall be placed in the Haunch Zone and compacted to Density Index DI 50
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Culverts alignments to comply with Melbourne Water and IFC tolerances.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Side Zone: Class 2 or 3 Crushed Rock to 90% Relative density, or min density index of 60.
– Class 2 or 3 Crushed Rock to 0.3m above the top of Culvert to 98% SMDD
– Class 2 or 3 Crushed Rock to 98% SMDD
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Top Surface of the erosion control mat to match FSL

○ Needle-punched non-woven Geotextile (mass > 250g/m2) to trimmed surface and buried to a depth of 300mm at the edges of beaching with 300mm - 500mm Overlap or as otherwise specified by the Supplier Installation Guidelines
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Bedding Min. 250mm depth of size 20- 100mm graded Crushed rock
○ Rocks placed mechanically / by hand for uniform interlocking layer
○ Infill mix placed between rockwork (mix size 0-100mm) shall be graded crushed rock
○ All rocks shall have a mass 20 and 70 kg and at least 60% of the total by number shall be over 40 kg
○ Rocks shall be of such size that the layer of beaching is not less than 225 mm thick
○ Rocks shall be keyed into Ground surface one third Diameter of rock
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
– Have all changes been approved and are within tolerance?
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -

Acceptance criteria - Prior to excavations being carried out, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out all drainage lines including manholes, temporary benchmarks, sewage wet wells etc.
○ Chainage, offsets, cut/fill level, cutting slopes, grades and cross sections specified or shown on the drawings, etc.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
Acceptance criteria - In accordance with IFC Drawings:
○ All pipework to be clearly labelled & detectable to identify it as stormwater drainage.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - All excavations subject to inspection prior to the installation of services and throughout the duration of the excavation.
○ Excavate to the lines, levels and grades as required for in ground services specified in accordance with the requirements of AS 3500.
○ Keep trench width & depth to that required by the service & pits bedding method.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Remove obstructions including roots, stumps, boulders and the like which may interfere with the proper functioning of the service
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Symal shall maintain all excavations in a well-drained condition.
○ No bedding material or pipe work shall be placed in excavations containing standing or running water.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - All Pipes shall be installed with well graded washed clean sand to AS3725
○ Bedding material to be placed the full width of the trench and not less than 100mm in thickness.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Bedding material shall be compacted to refusal handheld mechanical equipment to Density Index DI 50
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - All excavations subject to inspection prior to the installation of services and throughout the duration of the excavation.
○ Pipes shall be bedded evenly to ensure sockets to not bear on the base of the trench
○ Pipe laying shall commence at upstream end at downstream end of the run.
○ All pipes shall be laid with sockets pointing upstream.
○ Excavate to the lines, levels and grades as required for in ground services specified in accordance with the requirements of AS 3500.
○ Keep trench width & depth to that required by the service & its bedding method.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Install piping in straight lines at uniform grades without sags as per long section of drainage drawings.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Unless otherwise specified, tolerances as follows:
○ Minimum fall within pits between incoming and outgoing pipes should be kept as 20mm
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Provide all bends, junctions, inspection openings and other fittings as necessary for the completion of all systems.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Pits are to be constructed in accordance with project specifications, with internal surfaces and exposed surfaces finished smooth & true.
○ All pipe break-ins are to be made neat and finished smooth without gaps/cavities.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Accurately record the routes of underground cables and pipes before backfilling.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -

Acceptance criteria - After pipes & fittings have been set in the correct position, jointed, and tested, further bedding material shall be used to fill all recesses below sockets, and bottoms of trenches.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Backfill material must be placed and compacted in maximum 150mm (Haunch and Side Zone) 200mm layers (Overlay and Backfill Zone).
○ Backfill trenches as soon as possible after satisfactory testing & approval of laid and bedded service.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Haunch Zone: Bedding Sand compacted to Relative Density 90% or Density Index DI 60
○ Side Zone: Class 2 or 3 Crushed Rock Compacted to Relative Density 90%
○ Overlay Zone: Class 2 or 3 Crushed Rock to 150mm above the top of pipe to 98% SMDD
○ Backfill Zone: Class 2 or 3 Crushed Rock to 98% SMDD
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - On completion, each drainage line shall be free from dirt, debris, or other impediments.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Do not cover or conceal work until it has been inspected by Symal.
○ Leave pipe joints exposed to enable witness inspections.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -

name: Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Prior to excavations being carried out, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out all fire lines including hydrants and risers.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
Acceptance criteria - All materials selected in accordance with AS4130 and MREH civil specification and drawings.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Ref docs - AS2033 CI4 & PIPA (POP-001 & POP-003)

Acceptance criteria - Prior to welding commencing ensure Fusion Welding Equipment Calibration Certificate (every 3 months) and Welding Operator Qualification Certificate (every 2 years) are correct/approved prior to work commencement.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Calibration Certificate and Verification of competency
Acceptance criteria - All excavations subject to inspection prior to the installation of services and throughout the duration of the excavation.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
Acceptance criteria - Remove obstructions including roots, stumps, boulders, and the like which may, in the opinion of Symal, interfere with the proper functioning of the service.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - N/A
Acceptance criteria - Pipes should be bedded and supported with river sand.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - PSD Report
Acceptance criteria - Work shall be carried out by and under the direct supervision of appropriately licenced personnel.
○ During construction, temporarily seal open ends of pipes and valves to prevent the entry of foreign matter into pipe systems.
○ Install piping in straight lines at uniform grades without sags.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Visual inspection
Ref docs - AS4130 PIPA (POP1/ POP3 / POP14)
Acceptance criteria - Ensure pipe is cleaned and scraped prior to welding.
○ Ensure pipe is fixed firmly in position.
○ Allow curing time as per specific fittings recommendations.
○ Visually check all fittings have been welded.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - To comply with AS2419.1 and Drawing MRHA0B00-FPDWG004~0006
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Minimum depth of cover for buried pipes:
○ Min. 600mm cover from bottom of the conduits.
○ Min. 100mm from side of trench wall.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - After pipes & fittings have been set in the correct position and jointed, further bedding material shall be used to fill all recesses below sockets, and bottoms of trenches.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Backfill material must be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 200mm. Compaction requirement & thickness follows Earthworks package:
– 1 x test per 2 layers per 40 linear meters
○ Fire Hydrant marker tape to be placed prior to backfill.
○ Backfill trenches as soon as possible after approval of laid and bedded service.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Undertaken using hand methods only for first 300mm.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Prior to the commencement of works, the contractor shall engage a suitably qualified surveyor to set out the works and clearly mark its limits.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Visual inspection
Acceptance criteria - Materials used for the installation of Hydrants to be in accordance with AS2419
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Ensure fire hydrants are located such that they do not impact vehicle access.
○ Bollards are to be installed for physical protection.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Photo, if required
Acceptance criteria - On completion, each line shall be free from dirt, debris, or other impediments.
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) - Photo, if required
Acceptance criteria - All pipe and hydrants to be pressure tested in accordance with AS2419
Remarks/record (e.g. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc.) -
Acceptance criteria - Accurately record the routes of all underground pipes before backfilling.
